definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break up
to collapse/to fall into ruins/death of king or emperor/demise
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: A collapsed road in Urayasu city, in Chiba prefecture.
sentences.chinese: 千叶县浦安市崩裂的路。

sentences.english: The unusual tides caused glaciers to calve icebergs off Greenland.
sentences.chinese: 这种不寻常的潮汐使得格陵兰的冰川崩裂成冰山。

sentences.english: The border that seals with batten allows easy become damp or burst apart.
sentences.chinese: 用木条封的边轻易发潮或崩裂。

sentences.english: Relations that have formed over generations are suddenly broken apart.
sentences.chinese: 世代以来形成的关系也突然崩裂。

sentences.english: A blood vessel exploded in the left half of my brain.
sentences.chinese: 我的左脑里的一根脑血管崩裂了。

sentences.english: The stitching on the Chinese economy could fray and burst.
sentences.chinese: 中国经济的伤口会崩裂。

sentences.english: Rock that has been ground down by the elements becomes soil.
sentences.chinese: 由于风吹雨打日晒而崩裂的岩石化成了土壤。

sentences.english: SOMETIMES it takes but a single pebble to start an avalanche .
sentences.chinese: 有时一块小卵石就足以使冰山崩裂。

definition: to disintegrate/to shatter into small pieces
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
all split up and in pieces (idiom); disunity (in an organization)/complete lack of unity/to disintegrate/falling apart/to be at sixes and sevens
loudly/with a loud bang/a loud rumble
talus slide/to crumble (of scree slope)/to collapse/landslide
